metadata.title: The Coronavirus Nucleocapsid Is a Multifunctional Protein

abstract.original_text: Cape 7535, South Africa; E-Mails: rmcbride@uwc.ac.za (R.M.); 2917799@myuwc.ac.za (M.Z.) † These authors contributed equally to this work.

sentences.segment_text: Cape 7535 , South Africa ; E-Mails : rmcbride@uwc.ac.za ( R.M. ) ; 2917799@myuwc.ac.za ( M.Z. ) † These authors contributed equally to this work .

abstract.original_text: Abstract: The coronavirus nucleocapsid (N) is a structural protein that forms complexes with genomic RNA, interacts with the viral membrane protein during virion assembly and plays a critical role in enhancing the efficiency of virus transcription and assembly. Recent studies have confirmed that N is a multifunctional protein. The aim of this review is to highlight the properties and functions of the N protein, with specific reference to (i) the topology; (ii) the intracellular localization and (iii) the functions of the protein.

interacts with the viral membrane protein during virion assembly and plays a critical role in enhancing the efficiency of virus transcription and assembly .
Recent studies have confirmed that N is a multifunctional protein .
The aim of this review is to highlight the properties and functions of the N protein ,
with specific reference to ( i ) the topology ; ( ii ) the intracellular localization and ( iii ) the functions of the protein .
